Throws: if the builder has already transitioned to the built state
add(int).Description: Adds an element to the stream being built.

Throws: if the builder has already transitioned to the built state
accept(int).Description: Adds an element to the stream being built.

Throws: if the builder has already transitioned to the built state
build().Description: Builds the stream, transitioning this builder to the built state. An IllegalStateException is thrown if there are further attempts to operate on the builder after it has entered the built state.

ClassDesc: A mutable builder for an IntStream. A stream builder has a lifecycle, which starts in a building phase, during which elements can be added, and then transitions to a built phase, after which elements may not be added. The built phase begins when the @B_java#util#stream#IntStream#Builder#build_E@ method is called, which creates an ordered stream whose elements are the elements that were added to the stream builder, in the order they were added.
